_header: When I have pleased my lady now and then
Subjects: fragments; old age; women, unfaithfulness of

NYPLDrexFr4185.Transcription:
…Whan I haue plesyd my lady now & thanbut now she louyth A
                    noþer manby cause I can not as he canA lyttyll age but late by
                    fell by fellwhyche euer of ser[ ] dyd me expellnow yowthe ys come
                    þat beryth þe bellby cause I can not do so wellnow all ye
                    louers take hede off mefore ous I was as losty as ye& at [ ] my
                    all ye shalle beþer for come after & daunce with mefor all a
                    grene wyllo ys [my garl]and…
NYPLDrexFr4185.Note:
Portions of pages cut away to fit as endleaves to seventeenth-century
                    song book.
